title: Philipp Amthor
text:
Philipp Amthor (born 10 November 1992) is a German politician of the <a href="Christian%20Democratic%20Union%20of%20Germany">Christian Democratic Union</a> (CDU) who has been serving as a member of the <a href="Bundestag">Bundestag</a> since the <a href="2017%20German%20federal%20election">2017 German federal election</a>.
Education and early career.
Amthor was born 1992 in <a href="Ueckerm%C3%BCnde">Ueckermünde</a> and grew up in <a href="Torgelow">Torgelow</a>. He studied law at the <a href="University%20of%20Greifswald">University of Greifswald</a>, on a scholarship of the <a href="Konrad%20Adenauer%20Foundation">Konrad Adenauer Foundation</a> (KAS). Since 2017, he has been working as a research associate at the Berlin office of <a href="White%20%26amp%3B%20Case">White & Case</a>.
Political career.
Amthor joined the CDU in 2008. In the <a href="2017%20German%20federal%20election">2017 elections</a> he became member of the Bundestag as the directly elected MP for the <a href="Mecklenburgische%20Seenplatte%20I%20%E2%80%93%20Vorpommern-Greifswald%20II">Mecklenburgische Seenplatte I – Vorpommern-Greifswald II</a> constituency. In parliament, he has since been serving on the Committee on Internal Affairs (since 2018) and the Committee on European Affairs (2018–2021). Since the <a href="2021%20German%20federal%20election">2021 elections</a>, Amthor has been serving as his parliamentary group’s spokesperson for state modernization.
Since 2018, Amthor has been the <a href="treasurer">treasurer</a> of the <a href="Young%20Union">Young Union</a> (JU), making him part of the organization's leadership around chairman <a href="Tilman%20Kuban">Tilman Kuban</a>.
Following the resignation of <a href="Vincent%20Kokert">Vincent Kokert</a> as chairman of the CDU in <a href="Mecklenburg-Vorpommern">Mecklenburg-Vorpommern</a>, Amthor announced his candidacy for the role. Amid growing criticism of his lobbying activities on behalf of a private company, he declared in June 2020 that he would not run for the party's leadership in the state anymore.
Political positions.
Ahead of the Christian Democrats’ <a href="2018%20Christian%20Democratic%20Union%20of%20Germany%20leadership%20election">leadership election</a> in 2018, Amthor publicly endorsed <a href="Jens%20Spahn">Jens Spahn</a> to succeed <a href="Angela%20Merkel">Angela Merkel</a> as the party's chair. He later endorsed <a href="Friedrich%20Merz">Friedrich Merz</a> as <a href="Annegret%20Kramp-Karrenbauer">Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer</a>'s successor at the party's <a href="2021%20Christian%20Democratic%20Union%20of%20Germany%20leadership%20election">2021 leadership election</a>.
